data.enText: drew
drawn
make pictures

data.chText: （用铅笔、钢笔或粉笔）画，描绘，描画
data.enText: to make pictures, or a picture of sth, with a pencil, pen or chalk (but not paint)
You draw beautifully.

data.chText: 画画 / 示意图 / 曲线图
data.enText: to draw a picture/diagram/graph
She drew a house.

data.chText: 他用枝条在沙地上画了一个圆。
data.enText: He drew a circle in the sand with a stick.

data.chText: 这份报告描绘了一幅办事效率低下和贪污腐化的可怕景象。
data.enText: The report drew a grim picture of inefficiency and corruption.
pull
to move sth/sb by pulling it or them gently
He drew the cork out of the bottle.

data.chText: 我把椅子向火旁拉近了点。
data.enText: I drew my chair up closer to the fire.
She drew me onto the balcony.
I tried to draw him aside (= for example where I could talk to him privately) .

data.chText: 角落里的那个男人引起了我的注意。
data.enText: My eyes were drawn to the man in the corner.
to pull a vehicle such as a carriage

data.chText: 女王的御驾是由六匹马拉的。
data.enText: The Queen's coach was drawn by six horses.
a horse-drawn carriage
curtains
to open or close curtains, etc.
The blinds were drawn.

data.chText: 天快黑了，我打开灯，拉上了窗帘。
data.enText: It was getting dark so I switched on the light and drew the curtains.

data.chText: 她拉开窗帘让阳光照进来。
data.enText: She drew back the curtains and let the sunlight in.
move
to move in the direction mentioned
The train drew into the station.
The train drew in.

data.chText: 远处的人影好像越来越近。
data.enText: The figures in the distance seemed to be drawing closer.

data.chText: 他们的汽车与我们的并排行驶。
data.enText: Their car drew alongside ours.
Her retirement is drawing near.
The meeting was drawing to a close .
weapon
to take out a weapon, such as a gun or a sword , in order to attack sb

data.chText: 她拔出左轮手枪对准我。
data.enText: She drew a revolver on me.

data.chText: 他手持出鞘的剑向他们走来。
data.enText: He came towards them with his sword drawn.
attract
to attract or interest sb

data.chText: 这部影片吸引着大批观众。
data.enText: The movie is drawing large audiences.

data.chText: 她的惊叫声把过路人吸引到了现场。
data.enText: Her screams drew passers-by to the scene.

data.chText: 这课程吸引着来自全国各地的学生。
data.enText: The course draws students from all over the country.
get reaction

data.chText: 产生，引起，激起（反应或回应）
data.enText: to produce a reaction or response

data.chText: 公告博得观众的热烈掌声。
data.enText: The announcement drew loud applause from the audience.

data.chText: 这个计划引来众多批评。
data.enText: The plan has drawn a lot of criticism.
make sb talk
to make sb say more about sth

data.chText: 斯皮尔伯格拒绝透露他下一部影片的任何消息。
data.enText: Spielberg refused to be drawn on his next movie.
conclusion
to have a particular idea after you have studied sth or thought about it

data.chText: 你从这个报告中得出了什么结论？
data.enText: What conclusions did you draw from the report?

data.chText: 我们可以从这个事故中为今后吸取教训。
data.enText: We can draw some lessons for the future from this accident.
comparison
to express a comparison or a contrast

data.chText: 对两件事进行类比 / 对照 / 比较 / 区别
data.enText: to draw an analogy/a comparison/a parallel/a distinction between two events
choose
to decide sth by picking cards, tickets or numbers by chance
We drew for partners.

data.chText: 他们只得抽签决定谁去。
data.enText: They had to draw lots to decide who would go.
He drew the winning ticket.

data.chText: 从帽子里抽签来决定最后几个名额。
data.enText: Names were drawn from a hat for the last few places.

data.chText: 第一轮比赛的抽签结果是意大利队对西班牙队。
data.enText: Italy has been drawn against Spain in the first round.

data.chText: 抽签结果是意大利队对西班牙队。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: Italy has been drawn to play Spain.
game
to finish a game without either team winning

data.chText: 英格兰队和法国队打平。
data.enText: England and France drew.

data.chText: 英格兰队与法国队打成平局。
data.enText: England drew with/against France.

data.chText: 英格兰队与法国队打成三平。
data.enText: England and France drew 3–3.

data.chText: 英格兰队与法国队的比赛未分胜负。
data.enText: England drew their game against France.
money
to take money or payments from a bank account or post office

data.chText: 我可以从我的账户上提取80元钱吗？
data.enText: Can I draw $80 out of my account?
I drew out £200.

data.chText: 她到邮局去领取她的养老金。
data.enText: She went to the post office to draw her pension.

data.chText: 这张支票从他的个人账户中支付。
data.enText: The cheque was drawn on his personal account.
liquid/gas
to take or pull liquid or gas from somewhere
to draw water from a well

data.chText: 这装置将气体顺着管子抽出来。
data.enText: The device draws gas along the pipe.
smoke/air
to breathe in smoke or air

data.chText: 他若有所思地抽着烟斗。
data.enText: He drew thoughtfully on his pipe.

data.chText: 她深深地呼吸着山上的新鲜空气。
data.enText: She breathed deeply, drawing in the fresh mountain air.
draw a blank
to get no response or result

data.chText: 到目前为止警方的调查毫无结果。
data.enText: So far, the police investigation has drawn a blank.
draw blood
to make sb bleed
draw breath
draw a breath
to stop doing sth and rest

data.chText: 她一直滔滔不绝，几乎没停下来喘口气。
data.enText: She talks all the time and hardly stops to draw breath.
to live; to be alive

data.chText: 他是世上少有的大善人。
data.enText: He was as kind a man as ever drew breath.
draw sb's fire

data.chText: （为掩护他人）吸引…的火力，转移…的视线
data.enText: to make sb direct their anger, criticism, etc. at you, so that others do not have to face it
draw a line under sth
to say that sth is finished and not worth discussing any more
draw the line (at sth/at doing sth)
to refuse to do sth; to set a limit

data.chText: 我帮忙倒无所谓，但可不能什么事都让我做。
data.enText: I don't mind helping, but I draw the line at doing everything myself.

data.chText: 我们本倒是愿意邀请所有亲戚的，但总得有个限度呀。
data.enText: We would have liked to invite all our relatives, but you have to draw the line somewhere.
draw the line (between sth and sth)

data.chText: 划界线；区分（两个密切相关的思想）
data.enText: to distinguish between two closely related ideas

data.chText: 天才和疯狂之间如何划界呢？
data.enText: Where do you draw the line between genius and madness?
draw the short straw
get the short end of the stick

data.chText: 抽到倒霉签；被派做苦差事
data.enText: to be the person in a group who is chosen or forced to perform an unpleasant duty or task

data.chText: 我抽到了下下签，只得打扫厕所了。
data.enText: I drew the short straw and had to clean the toilets.
draw straws (for sth)
to decide on sb to do or have sth, by choosing pieces of paper, etc.
We drew straws for who went first.
the battle lines are drawn

data.chText: 战线已经划清（指争战之际各拥一方形成对垒之势）
data.enText: used to say that people or groups have shown which side they intend to support in an argument or contest that is going to begin
at daggers drawn
if two people are at daggers drawn , they are very angry with each other
draw yourself up/rise to your full height

data.chText: 昂首挺胸地站立（以示决心或地位高）
data.enText: to stand straight and tall in order to show your determination or high status
draw back
to move away from sb/sth

data.chText: 他一步步靠近，而她却一步步向后退。
data.enText: He came close but she drew back.
draw back (from sth/from doing sth)
to choose not to take action, especially because you feel nervous

data.chText: 我们撤回了对邻居的起诉。
data.enText: We drew back from taking our neighbours to court.
draw sth from sb/sth
to take or obtain sth from a particular source

data.chText: 从家人那里得到支持 / 安慰 / 力量
data.enText: to draw support/comfort/strength from your family

data.chText: 她从儿时的经历中获得灵感。
data.enText: She drew her inspiration from her childhood experiences.
draw in
to become dark earlier in the evening as winter gets nearer
The nights/days are drawing in.
draw sb into sth/into doing sth
draw sb↔in
to involve sb or make sb take part in sth, although they may not want to take part at first

data.chText: 身不由己卷入犯罪活动的年轻人
data.enText: youngsters drawn into a life of crime

data.chText: 这本书开始时情节展开得很慢，但渐渐地就把你给完全吸引住了。
data.enText: The book starts slowly, but it gradually draws you in.
draw sth↔off
to remove some liquid from a larger supply

data.chText: 医生排掉了一些液体以缓解压力。
data.enText: The doctor drew off some fluid to relieve the pressure.
draw on
if a time or a season draws on , it passes
Night was drawing on.
draw on/upon sth
to use a supply of sth that is available to you

data.chText: 我只得动用我的存款了。
data.enText: I'll have to draw on my savings.

data.chText: 这位小说家在很大程度上是以她的亲身经历为素材。
data.enText: The novelist draws heavily on her personal experiences.
draw out
to become lighter in the evening as summer gets nearer
The days/evenings are drawing out.
draw sb↔out
to encourage sb to talk or express themselves freely
draw sth↔out
to make sth last longer than usual or necessary

data.chText: 她拖拖沓沓采访了一个多小时。
data.enText: She drew the interview out to over an hour.
draw up
if a vehicle draws up , it arrives and stops

data.chText: 出租车在房子外面停了下来。
data.enText: The cab drew up outside the house.
draw sth↔up
to make or write sth that needs careful thought or planning
to draw up a contract/list
choosing
drawing

the act of choosing sth, for example the winner of a prize or the teams who play each other in a competition, usually by taking pieces of paper, etc. out of a container without being able to see what is written on them
the draw for the second round of the European Cup
The draw for the raffle takes place on Saturday.
sports/games
a game in which both teams or players finish with the same number of points
The match ended in a two-all draw.

data.chText: 他总算与史密斯打了个平局。
data.enText: He managed to hold Smith to a draw (= to stop him from winning when he seemed likely to do so) .
drawing
a competition in which the winners are chosen in a draw
a prize draw

data.chText: 由抽签决定对手的比赛
data.enText: a sports match for which the teams or players are chosen in a draw

data.chText: 利物浦队抽的签是在客场与曼彻斯特联队进行比赛。
data.enText: Liverpool have an away draw against Manchester United.

data.chText: 由抽签决定对手的系列比赛
data.enText: a set of matches for which the teams or players are chosen in a draw

data.chText: 在抽签系列比赛的上半区就只剩下两名种子选手了。
data.enText: There are only two seeded players left in the top half of the draw.
attraction
a person, a thing or an event that attracts a lot of people

data.chText: 她是目前爱尔兰音乐界最受欢迎的人物之一。
data.enText: She is currently one of the biggest draws on the Irish music scene.
smoke
an act of breathing in the smoke from a cigarette
be quick/fast on the draw
to be quick to understand or react in a new situation

data.chText: 你骗不了他，他脑筋一向很快。
data.enText: You can't fool him─ he's always quick on the draw.
to be quick at pulling out a gun in order to shoot it
the luck of the draw
the fact that chance decides sth, in a way that you cannot control

data.text: pull ♦ drag ♦ draw ♦ haul ♦ tow ♦ tug

data.chText: 以上各词均含拖、拉、拽之意。
data.enText: These words all mean to move sth in a particular direction, especially towards or behind you.
pull
to hold sth and move it in a particular direction; to hold or be attached to a vehicle and move it along behind you

data.chText: 把椅子再往桌子拉近些。
data.enText: Pull the chair nearer the table.
They use oxen to pull their carts.
drag

data.chText: 通常指使劲在地上拖、拉、拽：
data.enText: to pull sb/sth in a particular direction or behind you, usually along the ground, and especially with effort

data.chText: 这麻袋太重了，提不起来。你得拖着走。
data.enText: The sack is too heavy to lift─you'll have to drag it.
draw
( formal ) to move sb/sth by pulling them/it gently; to pull a vehicle such as a carriage

data.chText: 我把椅子向火旁拉近了点。
data.enText: I drew my chair closer to the fire.
a horse-drawn carriage
haul
to pull sb/sth to a particular place with a lot of effort
Fishermen were hauling in their nets.

data.chText: drag通常指在身后的地上拖，haul通常指朝面前拉、向上拽。drag常需要用力，而haul总是要用力。
data.enText: You usually drag sth behind you along the ground; you usually haul sth towards you, often upwards towards you. Dragging sth often needs effort, but hauling sth always does.
drag or haul?
tow

data.chText: 指用绳索拖、拉、牵引（汽车、船或轻型飞机）：
data.enText: to pull a car, boat or light plane behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain

data.chText: 我们的汽车被警察拖走了。
data.enText: Our car was towed away by the police.
tug

data.chText: 指朝某一方向用力拖、拉、拽：
data.enText: to pull sb/sth hard in a particular direction

data.chText: 她试图逃跑，但他把她拽了回来。
data.enText: She tried to escape but he tugged her back.
to pull/drag/draw/haul/tow/tug sth back/away/out
to pull/drag/draw/haul/tow/tug sb/sth along/down/towards sth
to pull/drag/draw/haul/tow sb/sth behind you
to pull/draw a coach/carriage/sledge
to pull/haul/tow a truck
to pull/haul a train
horses pull/draw/haul sth
dogs pull/drag/haul sth
engines/locomotives pull/haul sth

word_means: 由抽签决定对手的比赛

means: 产生，引起，激起（反应或回应）
由抽签决定对手的比赛

ex.chText: 她的小弟弟总是拽她的头发。
ex.enText: Her little brother was always pulling her hair.

ex.chText: 她把儿子轻轻地拉到身边。
ex.enText: She pulled her son gently towards her.

synonyms.bx: 指用手把某物或某人拉向身边或沿着某个方向拉过去。

ex.chText: 她费了很大劲把单人床拖进卧室里。
ex.enText: She managed to drag the single bed to her bedroom.

ex.chText: 那位母亲硬把儿子拽进了幼儿园。
ex.enText: The mother dragged her son into the kindergarten.

synonyms.bx: 指某物因太沉而只能在地面拖着走，也指硬拽某人到其并不想去的地方。

ex.chText: 她把一把椅子拉到壁炉边。
ex.enText: She drew a chair up to the fireplace.
Don't forget to draw the curtains.

ex.chText: 他俯身把同伴拉上墙头。
ex.enText: He reached down and hauled his partner up onto the wall.

ex.chText: 那辆火车是由蒸汽机车拖动的。
ex.enText: The train was hauled by the steam locomotive.

synonyms.bx: 强调一直要用力，方向通常是朝前或向上。

ex.chText: 他的车什么时候被警察拖走的？
ex.enText: When was his car towed away by the police?

ex.chText: 那艘船出了点问题，不得不被拖进港口。
ex.enText: Something was wrong with the ship, and it had to be towed into the harbour.

synonyms.bx: 指用绳索或链条拖拉车或船。

ex.chText: 你认识拽她袖子的男人吗？
ex.enText: Do you know the man who was tugging at her sleeve?

ex.chText: 站在他后面的女人轻轻拽了拽她的胳膊。
ex.enText: The woman standing behind him gently tugged his arm.

synonyms.bx: 强调动作发生的时间短而迅速。

trans: 使畅所欲言；使愿意交谈

tr: the act of drawing or hauling something
example: the haul up the hill went very slowly

tr: poker in which a player can discard cards and receive substitutes from the dealer
example: he played only draw and stud

tr: (American football) the quarterback moves back as if to pass and then hands the ball to the fullback who is running toward the line of scrimmage
a golf shot that curves to the left for a right-handed golfer
example: he took lessons to cure his hooking

tr: a playing card or cards dealt or taken from the pack
example: he got a pair of kings in the draw

tr: anything (straws or pebbles etc.) taken or chosen at random
example: the luck of the draw
they drew lots for it

tr: the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
example: the game ended in a draw
their record was 3 wins, 6 losses and a tie

tr: a gully that is shallower than a ravine
an entertainer who attracts large audiences
example: he was the biggest drawing card they had

tr: cause to localize at one point
example: Draw blood and pus

tr: flatten, stretch, or mold metal or glass, by rolling or by pulling it through a die or by stretching
example: draw steel

tr: remove the entrails of
example: draw a chicken

tr: steep
pass through a strainer
example: draw pulp from the fruit

tr: reduce the diameter of (a wire or metal rod) by pulling it through a die
example: draw wire

tr: contract
example: The material drew after it was washed in hot water

tr: bring or lead someone to a certain action or condition
example: She was drawn to despair
The President refused to be drawn into delivering an ultimatum
The session was drawn to a close

tr: select or take in from a given group or region
example: The participants in the experiment were drawn from a representative population

tr: make, formulate, or derive in the mind
example: I draw a line here
draw a conclusion
draw parallels
make an estimate
What do you make of his remarks?

tr: give a description of
example: He drew an elaborate plan of attack

tr: choose at random
example: draw a card
cast lots

tr: finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
example: The teams drew a tie

tr: suck in or take (air)
example: draw a deep breath
draw on a cigarette

tr: pass over, across, or through
example: He ran his eyes over her body
She ran her fingers along the carved figurine
He drew her hair through his fingers

tr: move or pull so as to cover or uncover something
example: draw the shades
draw the curtains

tr: stretch back a bowstring (on an archer's bow)
example: The archers were drawing their bows

tr: thread on or as if on a string
example: string pearls on a string
the child drew glass beads on a string
thread dried cranberries

tr: cause to move by pulling
example: draw a wagon
pull a sled

tr: direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
example: Her good looks attract the stares of many men
The ad pulled in many potential customers
This pianist pulls huge crowds
The store owner was happy that the ad drew in many new customers

tr: take in, also metaphorically
example: The sponge absorbs water well
She drew strength from the minister's words

tr: make a mark or lines on a surface
example: draw a line
trace the outline of a figure in the sand

tr: earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher
example: He drew a base on balls

tr: engage in drawing
example: He spent the day drawing in the garden

tr: represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
example: She drew an elephant
Draw me a horse

tr: write a legal document or paper
example: The deed was drawn in the lawyer's office

tr: elicit responses, such as objections, criticism, applause, etc.
example: The President's comments drew sharp criticism from the Republicans
The comedian drew a lot of laughter

tr: take liquid out of a container or well
example: She drew water from the barrel

tr: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
example: draw a weapon
pull out a gun
The mugger pulled a knife on his victim

tr: move or go steadily or gradually
example: The ship drew near the shore

tr: cause to flow
example: The nurse drew blood

tr: cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
example: A declining dollar pulled down the export figures for the last quarter

tr: get or derive
example: He drew great benefits from his membership in the association

tr: remove (a commodity) from (a supply source)
example: She drew $2,000 from the account
The doctors drew medical supplies from the hospital's emergency bank

tr: pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
example: in the old days, people were drawn and quartered for certain crimes

tr: require a specified depth for floating
example: This boat draws 70 inches

tr: allow a draft
example: This chimney draws very well

value.def: When you draw, or when you draw something, you use a pencil or pen to produce a picture, pattern, or diagram.

example.ex: She would sit there drawing with the pencil stub...
example.tran: 她会坐在那儿用铅笔头画画。

example.ex: Draw a rough design for a logo...
example.tran: 画一个公司标志的草图。

example.ex: He starts a painting by quickly drawing simplified shapes.
example.tran: 他画图时先快速勾勒出大致的轮廓。

example.ex: I like dancing, singing and drawing.
example.tran: 我喜欢跳舞、唱歌和画画。

value.def: When a vehicle draws somewhere, it moves there smoothly and steadily.

example.ex: Claire had seen the taxi drawing away...
example.tran: 克莱尔看到出租车缓缓开走了。

example.ex: A carriage door struck him as a train drew into Basildon station.
example.tran: 当火车驶进巴斯尔登站时，一节车厢的门撞到他了。

value.def: If you draw somewhere, you move there slowly.

example.ex: She drew away and did not smile...
example.tran: 她慢慢走开了，脸上没有笑容。

example.ex: When we drew level, he neither slowed down nor accelerated.
example.tran: 当我们齐头并进时，他既没有慢下来也没有加速。

value.def: If you draw something or someone in a particular direction, you move them in that direction, usually by pulling them gently.

example.ex: He drew his chair nearer the fire...
example.tran: 他把椅子拉到离炉火更近的位置。

example.ex: He put his arm around Caroline's shoulders and drew her close to him...
example.tran: 他一只手臂搂住卡罗琳的肩膀，将她拉近自己。

example.ex: Wilson drew me aside after an interview.
example.tran: 采访后威尔逊把我拉到了一边。

value.def: When you draw a curtain or blind, you pull it across a window, either to cover or to uncover it.

example.ex: After drawing the curtains, she lit a candle...
example.tran: 拉上窗帘后，她点燃了蜡烛。

example.ex: Mother was lying on her bed, with the blinds drawn.
example.tran: 母亲正躺在床上，百叶窗已经拉了下来。

value.def: If someone draws a gun, knife, or other weapon, they pull it out of its container and threaten you with it.

example.ex: He drew his dagger and turned to face his pursuers.
example.tran: 他拔出匕首转身面向追他的人。

value.tran: 拔出，抽出，掏出(枪、刀等武器)

value.def: If an animal or vehicle draws something such as a cart, carriage, or another vehicle, it pulls it along.

example.ex: ...a slow-moving tractor, drawing a trailer.
example.tran: 拖着一辆挂车的移动缓慢的拖拉机

example.ex: ...a chariot drawn by six black mules.
example.tran: 6 匹黑色骡子拉着的一辆双轮敞篷马车

value.def: If you draw a deep breath, you breathe in deeply once.

example.ex: He paused, drawing a deep breath.
example.tran: 他停了下来，深深地吸了口气。

value.def: If you draw on a cigarette, you breathe the smoke from it into your mouth or lungs.

example.ex: He drew on an American cigarette...
example.tran: 他抽着一根美国产的香烟。

example.ex: Her cheeks hollowed as she drew smoke into her lungs.
example.tran: 当她把烟吸进肺里时，她的双颊瘪了下去。

value.def: To draw something such as water or energy from a particular source means to take it from that source.

example.ex: Villagers still have to draw their water from wells.
example.tran: 村民们仍然要从井里打水。

value.def: If something that hits you or presses part of your body draws blood, it cuts your skin so that it bleeds.

example.ex: Any practice that draws blood could increase the risk of getting the virus.
example.tran: 任何引起出血的做法都可能会增加感染病毒的危险。

value.def: If you draw money out of a bank, building society, or savings account, you get it from the account so that you can use it.

example.ex: She was drawing out cash from a cash machine...
example.tran: 她正从自动提款机中取钱。

example.ex: Companies could not draw money from bank accounts as cash.
example.tran: 公司不能从银行账户中提取现金。

value.def: If you draw a salary or a sum of money, you receive a sum of money regularly.

example.ex: For the first few years I didn't draw any salary at all...
example.tran: 在开始的几年里我分文未取。

example.ex: He is moving ever closer to drawing his pension.
example.tran: 他就要领取养老金了。

value.def: To draw something means to choose it or to be given it, as part of a competition, game, or lottery.

example.ex: We delved through a sackful of letters to draw the winning name...
example.tran: 我们把手探进一袋信件中抽取获奖者。

example.ex: Aston Villa have drawn a Czech team in the first round of the UEFA Cup.
example.tran: 欧洲联盟杯首轮阿斯顿维拉队抽到了一支捷克球队。

example.ex: ...the draw for the quarter-finals of the UEFA Cup.
example.tran: 欧洲联盟杯四分之一决赛的抽签

value.tran: (在比赛等中)抽(签);(在摸彩中)抽(奖)

value.def: A draw is a competition where people pay money for numbered or named tickets, then some of those tickets are chosen, and the owners are given prizes.
To draw something from a particular thing or place means to take or get it from that thing or place.

example.ex: I draw strength from the millions of women who have faced this challenge successfully...
example.tran: 我从数百万成功面对这种挑战的女性身上汲取力量。

example.ex: The students are drawn from a cross-section of backgrounds.
example.tran: 这些学生是从成长背景具代表性的候选群体中选取出来的。

value.def: If you draw a particular conclusion, you decide that that conclusion is true.

example.ex: He draws two conclusions from this...
example.tran: 他从这件事中得出两个结论。

example.ex: He says he cannot yet draw any conclusions about the murders.
example.tran: 他说他还不能对几起谋杀下结论。

value.def: If you draw a comparison, parallel, or distinction, you compare or contrast two different ideas, systems, or other things.

example.ex: ...literary critics drawing comparisons between George Sand and George Eliot...
example.tran: 将乔治·桑德和乔治·艾略特进行比较的文学评论家

example.ex: Interesting distinctions can be drawn between the two populations.
example.tran: 比较两类人可以发现有趣的差异。

value.tran: 作(比较或对比)；加以(区别)

value.def: If you draw someone's attention to something, you make them aware of it or make them think about it.

example.ex: He was waving his arms to draw their attention...
example.tran: 他正挥手以引起他们的注意。

example.ex: He just wants to draw attention to the plight of the unemployed.
example.tran: 他仅仅是想引起人们对失业者困境的关注。

value.def: If someone or something draws a particular reaction, people react to it in that way.

example.ex: Such a policy would inevitably draw fierce resistance from farmers.
example.tran: 这种政策必然会招致农场主的强烈抵制。

example.ex: ...an official tour to South Africa which drew angry political reactions.
example.tran: 引起政治上的愤怒反应的一次官方的南非之行

value.def: If something such as a film or an event draws a lot of people, it is so interesting or entertaining that a lot of people go to it.

example.ex: The game is currently drawing huge crowds.
example.tran: 这个游戏现在吸引了很多人。

value.def: If someone or something draws you, it attracts you very strongly.

example.ex: He drew and enthralled her...
example.tran: 他令她动心，让她着迷。

example.ex: What drew him to the area was its proximity to central London.
example.tran: 吸引他到该地区的原因是那里靠近伦敦市中心。

value.tran: 使倾心;使动心;强烈吸引

value.def: If someone will not be drawn or refuses to be drawn, they will not reply to questions in the way that you want them to, or will not reveal information or their opinion.

example.ex: The ambassador would not be drawn on questions of a political nature...
example.tran: 大使不会对政治问题发表意见。

example.ex: 'Did he say why?' — 'No, he refuses to be drawn.'
example.tran: “他说为什么了吗？”——“没有,他拒绝透露任何消息。”

value.tran: 使回答;使透露消息;使说出意见

value.def: In a game or competition, if one person or team draws with another one, or if two people or teams draw, they have the same number of points or goals at the end of the game.

example.ex: Holland and the Republic of Ireland drew one-one...
example.tran: 荷兰队和爱尔兰队打成了一比一平。

example.ex: We drew with Ireland in the first game...
example.tran: 在第一场比赛中我们和爱尔兰队打平了。

example.ex: Egypt drew two of their matches in Italy.
example.tran: 埃及在意大利收获了两场平局。

example.ex: We were happy to come away with a draw against Sweden.
example.tran: 我们很高兴能和瑞典队战平。

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 tie

value.def: When an event or period of time draws to a close or draws to an end, it finishes.

example.ex: Another celebration had drawn to its close.
example.tran: 又一场庆典结束了。

value.def: If an event or period of time is drawing closer or is drawing nearer, it is approaching.

example.ex: And all the time next spring's elections are drawing closer...
example.tran: 明年春天的选举即将来临。

example.ex: As the day set for departure drew near, I told my wife that I could not accompany them.
example.tran: 起程的日子就要到了,我告诉妻子我不能陪他们了。

trans: 起草；制定；草拟；把（椅子）拉近
凭借；利用；动用；（时光）渐渐过去
（白昼）渐短；（天黑）渐早；使参与；使卷入；深呼吸；吸入（空气）
